title: Representation of ball's motion after 2D collision

content.question: Two balls are on a frictionless horizontal tabletop. Ball X initially moves at 10 meters per second, as shown in Figure I above. It then collides elastically with identical ball Y, which is initially at rest. After the collision, ball X moves at 6 meters per second along a path at 53Â° to its original direction, as shown in Figure II above. Which of the following diagrams best represents the motion of ball Y after the collision?

choices.label: A diagram shows a ball, labeled v equals 0, on a horizontal dashed line.
A diagram shows a ball with a rightward arrow, labeled 10 meters per second, pointing from it and extending toward the right.
A diagram shows ball on a ray, labeled 4 meters per second, drawn at an angle of 37 degrees below and from a horizontal dashed line.
A diagram shows ball on a ray, labeled 8 meters per second, drawn at an angle of 37 degrees below and from a horizontal dashed line.
A diagram shows ball on a ray, labeled 8 meters per second, drawn at an angle of 53 degrees below and from a horizontal dashed line.

content.answer: A diagram shows ball on a ray, labeled 8 meters per second, drawn at an angle of 37 degrees below and from a horizontal dashed line.
